sentences.english: He was by no means a tidyman, buthe had no wish to bring any trace of the autopsy room home on his shoes.
sentences.chinese: 虽说没有洁癖，但绝不希望有这些被粘在鞋上带回家。

sentences.english: IT is a fanatic for cleanliness.
Are you an inbox zero freak like me?
sentences.chinese: 你像我一样是个收件箱洁癖症患者吗？

sentences.english: WIDOW who was fond of cleaning had two little maidens to wait on her.
sentences.chinese: 有个有洁癖的寡妇，雇佣了两个女仆来伺候她。

sentences.english: Some become hyperneat adults, fearful of falling into the same pattern.
sentences.chinese: 有些人成年后会变成洁癖，害怕再陷入相同的模式中。

sentences.english: but don't become an obsessive-compulsive cleaner.
sentences.chinese: 但是不要变得太有洁癖。

sentences.english: Actually, I'm a bit of a neat freak.
Phoebe is an old roommate of Monica, she can not stand cleanliness of Monica and removed.
sentences.chinese: 菲比为莫妮卡的旧室友，后因受不了其洁癖而搬走。

sentences.english: She is a fanatic for cleanliness.
It can also be used for those who are mysophobia and often go on bussiness trips.
sentences.chinese: 如果有洁癖又经常出差的人士也可以穿这样的睡衣。

sentences.english: Our obsession with cleaning could be linked to rising rates of depression, scientists claim.
sentences.chinese: 科学家称，过分洁癖可能会令人更加抑郁。

sentences.english: Or should neat freaks loosen up?
sentences.chinese: 还是洁癖鬼该放松一下？

sentences.english: Men are commonly seen complaining about women's obsession with cleaning, organizing and categorizing.
sentences.chinese: 所以呢，男人总是在抱怨女人的洁癖和井井有条。

definition: lit. to blow apart the hairs upon a fur to discover any defect (idiom); fig. to be fastidious/nitpick
grumpiness associated with poor sleep/irritability in the morning
